timeline.author: larshelge

replies.bodyText:
We should really talk about this and have a common strategy.
In my opinion, Rule-engine versioning should not follow DHIS2-core versioning, it should be completely independent.
replies.author: enricocolasante

timeline.bodyText: Would be good to have a Javadoc on the interface methods to explain what "evaluate" means and which effects are run
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio
luciano-fiandesio

timeline.bodyText:
In general, using Optional as method argument is considered a bad practice (kind of controversial). Also read Java 10 docs: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/10/docs/api/java/util/Optional.html

Optional is primarily intended for use as a method return type where there is a clear need to represent "no result," and where using null is likely to cause errors. A variable whose type is Optional should never itself be null; it should always point to an Optional instance.
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio

+        Optional<ProgramStageInstance> psiToEvaluate );

replies.bodyText:
I can simply remove it and make it nullable, it is not pretty either, but I will not pass Optional as a parameter.
Anyway, we can discuss more about it

replies.bodyText:
It is duplicated but it is slightly different because the implement method is called one time for ProgramInstance and another time for ProgramStageInstance.
I will eventually refactor it to avoid this duplication, just not yet.

timeline.bodyText: Same consideration as before regarding Optional as method param
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio

timeline.bodyText:
Why do we need to open a transaction here? It seems that all the dependencies open their own TX?
Also, I noticed that the class DefaultProgramRuleService uses a class level @Transactional annotation, which open a read/write TX also for get only method. I know it's outside the scope of this PR, but perhaps we can fix it.
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio

timeline.bodyText: (minor) Missing javadoc, either remove the @param or fill the missing info
